description.narrative: - IFC''s proposed investment will help LOIL become a leader in adopting latest practices to ensure clean production. This is significant, especially in an industry where most medium-scale chemical manufacturers tend to follow polluting processes with minimal investment in waste effluent handling. LOIL has designed a zero discharge ETP for additional effluents generated from expansion projects where processed effluent will be used as feed water. - The proposed investment in a thermal co-generation power plant will provide the most efficient âEnergy and Product Integration'' solution between steam intensive ETAC plant and power intensive DD plant. - LOIL is in the process of carrying out R&D for cost effective thermal solar panels which has potential to integrate with co-generation unit in DD plant. This pioneer design will mitigate LOIL''s reliance on fossil fuels and reduce its greenhouse gas footprint. - The proposed expansion is expected to create nearly 70 jobs over the next two years and result in other indirect development benefits such as linkages with local suppliers, upgrade of existing infrastructure, and indirect employment creation through auxiliary businesses in the region and during construction phase. - Considering that 70% of India''s current requirement for DD products is being imported, the proposed investment will facilitate self sufficiency and conserve foreign exchange.

Laxmi Organic Industries Ltd (LOIL or the Company) is an Indian company producing specialty chemicals used in diverse end-user industries. The Company is undertaking an expansion (the Project), comprising brown field expansion of ethyl acetate (ETAC) and diketene derivatives (DD) products capacities, a coal fired co-generation facility and a greenfield facility to produce acetic anhydride.
